canonical_explanation.text: Light is a form of energy that helps us see. Natural sources include the Sun, stars, fire, and lightning. Artificial sources include bulbs, torches, and candles. Light travels in straight lines and very fast. Objects are classified by how they interact with light: transparent objects let all light pass through (glass, water), translucent objects let some light pass through (frosted glass, oiled paper), and opaque objects block all light (wood, metal). Shadows form when opaque objects block light. A shadow has the same shape as the object and appears on the opposite side of the light source. Shadow size changes with the position of the light source. Reflection is light bouncing off surfaces; smooth shiny surfaces like mirrors reflect light well.
rules: Light is a form of energy that helps us see
Natural light sources: Sun, stars, fire, lightning
Artificial light sources: bulbs, torches, candles
Transparent objects allow all light to pass through
Translucent objects allow some light to pass through
Opaque objects block all light and form shadows
Shadows form when light is blocked by opaque objects
Shadow size changes with light source position
Reflection is light bouncing off surfaces

questions.question_text: Which of these is a natural source of light?
questions.explanation_correct: The Sun is a natural source of light because it is a star that produces its own light. Natural sources of light are things that make their own light, like the Sun, stars, fire, and lightning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A torch, a bulb, and a tube light are all artificial sources of light. They produce light using electricity, which is made by humans. Natural sources of light are things that make their own light, like the Sun, stars, fire, and lightning.

questions.question_text: Which of these is an artificial source of light?
questions.explanation_correct: An electric bulb is an artificial source of light, meaning it is made by humans to produce light. Unlike natural sources of light like the Sun, stars, and lightning, electric bulbs are human-made and use electricity to generate light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stars, fireflies, and lightning are all natural sources of light, meaning they are found in nature and not made by humans. An electric bulb is an artificial source of light because it is a human-made device that uses electricity to produce light, unlike natural light sources.

questions.question_text: Light travels in:
questions.explanation_correct: Light travels in straight lines because that is the fastest and most efficient way for it to move. Light does not curve or go in circles, it moves in a straight path from the light source.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Light does not travel in curved, zigzag, or circular paths. It moves in straight lines because that is the natural way for light energy to move. Straight line movement is the fastest and most efficient path for light to take.

questions.question_text: Objects through which light passes completely are called:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) Transparent. Transparent objects are those that let all light pass through them, such as glass or clear water. This allows you to see clearly through them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C) Transparent. Transparent objects allow all light to pass through, so you can see clearly through them. Opaque objects (A) block all light and do not let any light pass through. Translucent objects (B) let some light pass through, but you cannot see clearly through them. Dark (D) is not a type of object interaction with light - it refers to the absence of light.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a transparent object?
questions.explanation_correct: Clear glass is a transparent object. This means that it allows all light to pass through it, so we can see through glass clearly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wood, cardboard, and metal are all opaque objects. This means they block light and don't let it pass through. So they cannot be used to see through, and they will create shadows when light hits them.

questions.question_text: Objects through which only some light passes are called:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) Translucent. Translucent objects are those that allow some light to pass through, but not all of it. This means that you can see shapes and shadows through them, but not clear details. Examples of translucent objects include frosted glass, oiled paper, and some types of plastic.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. A) Transparent objects let all light pass through, so you can see clear details. B) Opaque objects block all light, so you cannot see anything through them. D) Luminous objects are those that produce their own light, like the Sun or a light bulb. Translucent objects are the ones that allow some light to pass through, which is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which of these is an opaque object?
questions.explanation_correct: Stone is an opaque object because it does not let any light pass through. Opaque objects block all light and do not allow you to see through them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Clear water, clean air, and glass windows are not opaque objects. They are transparent or translucent, which means they allow some or all light to pass through them. Only stone is an opaque object that blocks all light and does not let you see through it.

questions.question_text: A shadow is formed when:

options.text: Light is blocked by an opaque object

questions.explanation_correct: A shadow is formed when light is blocked by an opaque object. Opaque objects do not let light pass through, so they block the light and create a dark area on the other side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shadow is not formed when light passes through an object, as the light will just continue to travel through the transparent or translucent object. Shadows also do not form when there is no light source, as light is needed to create a shadow. Shadows are also not formed by light being reflected, as reflection just means the light bounces off a surface.

questions.question_text: To form a shadow, you need:

options.text: A light source, an opaque object, and a screen

questions.explanation_correct: To form a shadow, you need a light source, an opaque object that blocks the light, and a screen or surface for the shadow to appear on. The opaque object casts a shadow on the screen when the light is blocked by it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Only having a light source is not enough to form a shadow - you also need an opaque object to block the light. Transparent objects do not block light, so they cannot create shadows. An opaque object is needed to block the light and cast a shadow on a surface or screen.

questions.question_text: The shadow of an object has the same:
questions.explanation_correct: The shadow of an object has the same shape as the object because the shadow is formed when the opaque object blocks the path of light, creating a dark area on the surface behind it. The shadow takes the exact shape of the object that is blocking the light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The shadow of an object does not have the same color, weight, or temperature as the object. The shadow is simply a dark area where light is blocked, and it does not have any of the physical properties of the actual object. The only thing the shadow shares with the object is its shape, as the shadow is an outline of the object on the surface behind it.

questions.question_text: When light bounces off a surface, it is called:
questions.explanation_correct: When light bounces off a surface, it is called reflection. Reflection is when light hits a surface and then bounces back, like a ball bouncing off a wall.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Absorption is when light is absorbed by an object and not reflected. Refraction is when light bends as it passes through different materials, like when a pencil in water looks bent. A shadow is the dark area created when an object blocks the path of light, not when light bounces off a surface.

questions.question_text: Which surface reflects light best?
questions.explanation_correct: A mirror reflects light best because it has a smooth, shiny surface. Light bounces off the mirror very well, so you can see a clear reflection in it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rough wall, black cloth, and cardboard do not reflect light very well. These surfaces are not smooth and shiny like a mirror, so they do not reflect light as clearly. Mirrors have a special surface that allows them to reflect light very efficiently, which is why they are the best choice for reflecting light.

questions.question_text: Frosted glass is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: Frosted glass is a translucent object. This means it lets some light pass through, but not all of it. Light can partially go through frosted glass, but you can't clearly see objects on the other side.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Frosted glass is not a transparent object because it does not let all light pass through. It is also not an opaque object because some light can still get through. Frosted glass is a translucent object, which means it allows some light to pass through, but not completely.

questions.question_text: Why can we not see around corners?
questions.explanation_correct: We cannot see around corners because light travels in straight lines. This means light cannot bend around corners, so we cannot see what is behind them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct reasons why we cannot see around corners. Light is not too fast, our eyes are not too small, and corners are not too dark. The correct reason is that light travels in straight lines, so it cannot bend around corners to let us see what is behind them.

questions.question_text: Your shadow is longest in the:

options.text: Morning or evening when sun is low

questions.explanation_correct: Your shadow is longest in the morning or evening when the sun is low because the light from the sun hits the object at a low angle, making the shadow longer. When the sun is high in the afternoon, the light hits the object more directly, making the shadow shorter.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Your shadow is not longest in the afternoon when the sun is high because the light from the sun hits the object more directly, making the shadow shorter. It is also not longest at night time or on a cloudy day because there is less light, so the shadow will not be as long.

questions.question_text: If you move a torch closer to an object, the shadow will:
questions.explanation_correct: When you move a torch closer to an object, the shadow becomes larger. This is because the light from the torch is shining on the object at a steeper angle, creating a bigger shadow on the wall or surface behind the object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The shadow does not become smaller or stay the same when you move the torch closer to the object. This is because the light from the torch is now hitting the object at a different angle, which changes the size of the shadow. The shadow actually becomes larger when the torch is moved closer to the object.

questions.question_text: Why can we see through a window but not through a wall?

options.text: Window is transparent, wall is opaque

questions.explanation_correct: The window is transparent, which means it allows light to pass through it. The wall is opaque, which means it blocks all light and does not let any light pass through it. This is why we can see through the window but not through the wall.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The wall is not heavier, newer, or taller than the window. The reason we can see through the window but not the wall is because the window is transparent and lets light pass through, while the wall is opaque and blocks all the light.

questions.question_text: We can see ourselves in a mirror because:

options.text: Mirror reflects light to our eyes

questions.explanation_correct: We can see ourselves in a mirror because the mirror reflects light back to our eyes. When light hits the smooth, shiny surface of the mirror, it bounces off and goes back to our eyes, allowing us to see our reflection.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Mirrors do not absorb light, produce light, or let all light pass through. They reflect light, which means the light bounces off the mirror's surface and goes back to our eyes, allowing us to see our reflection. This is why the correct answer is that mirrors reflect light to our eyes.

questions.question_text: Why is your shadow always on the opposite side of the light source?

options.text: Your body blocks light from reaching that area
Shadows only form in dark places

questions.explanation_correct: Your shadow is always on the opposite side of the light source because your body blocks the light from reaching that area, creating a shadow. This is why the shadow has the same shape as your body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shadows do not form because they are afraid of light or because light pushes them away. Shadows form when an opaque object like your body blocks the light, so the shadow appears on the opposite side of the light source. Shadows can form in both dark and light places, as long as there is a light source and an opaque object to block the light.

questions.question_text: Why do we use curtains on windows?

options.text: To block some or all light from entering

questions.explanation_correct: We use curtains on windows to block some or all of the light from entering the room. Curtains are made of opaque materials that do not let light pass through, so they can control the amount of light in the room.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not use curtains to make the room brighter, because curtains block light instead of letting it in. We also don't use curtains to make the window stronger or to make the room warmer. Curtains are specifically used to control the amount of light that enters a room by blocking some or all of the light.

questions.question_text: During a power cut at night, you cannot see because:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) There is no light source. During a power cut at night, all the artificial light sources like bulbs and lamps are turned off. Without any light source, we cannot see because our eyes need light to work and see things around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect. A) Your eyes do not stop working during a power cut. C) The air does not become darker, it is the lack of light that makes it dark. D) The objects do not disappear, they are still there, but we cannot see them without any light source.

questions.question_text: In a solar eclipse, the Moon's shadow falls on Earth because:

options.text: The Moon blocks sunlight reaching Earth

questions.explanation_correct: The Moon's shadow falls on Earth during a solar eclipse because the Moon blocks the sunlight from reaching Earth. The Moon's dark silhouette is cast on Earth's surface, creating a shadow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Moon does not produce its own light. It only reflects the light from the Sun. During a solar eclipse, the Moon passes between the Sun and Earth, blocking the sunlight from reaching Earth and casting its shadow on Earth's surface. The Sun does not turn off during an eclipse, and the Earth continues to rotate normally.

questions.question_text: At noon, your shadow is smallest because:
questions.explanation_correct: At noon, the Sun is directly overhead, which means your shadow is smallest. This is because the light from the Sun is shining straight down on you, creating a smaller shadow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the reason your shadow is smallest at noon. The time of day (noon) when the Sun is directly overhead is the reason your shadow is smallest, not the temperature or whether you are eating lunch. More light does not make the shadow smaller - in fact, more light would make the shadow larger.

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct?
questions.explanation_correct: Opaque objects form shadows because they block the light from passing through. Transparent objects like glass let light pass through, so they do not form shadows.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Transparent objects like glass and water do not form shadows because they allow light to pass through them. Opaque objects like wood and metal block the light, so they create shadows on the other side. Shadows are not formed by all objects, only by opaque ones that block the light.

questions.question_text: We see most objects because:

options.text: They reflect light into our eyes

questions.explanation_correct: We see most objects because they reflect light into our eyes. Light from a source, like the Sun or a lamp, bounces off the object and enters our eyes, allowing us to see the object's shape, color, and details.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Objects do not produce their own light like the Sun or a light bulb. Our eyes also do not produce light - they only detect light that enters them. Similarly, objects that absorb all light would appear completely dark and we would not be able to see them. The correct answer is that we see most objects because they reflect light into our eyes.

questions.question_text: A firefly is an example of a:
questions.explanation_correct: A firefly is a natural light source, like the Sun or stars. It produces its own light through a chemical reaction, which makes it glow. This makes it a natural source of light, not an artificial one like a light bulb.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A firefly is not an artificial light source, like a light bulb or torch. It is a living creature that produces its own light through a chemical reaction in its body. This natural light is what helps us see fireflies glowing at night, so the correct answer is that a firefly is a natural light source.

questions.question_text: Why do bathroom windows often have frosted glass?

options.text: To let some light in but provide privacy

questions.explanation_correct: Bathroom windows often have frosted glass because it lets some light in, but also provides privacy. Frosted glass is a type of translucent object that allows some light to pass through, but not all of it. This is useful in bathrooms where you want light to come in, but you also want to block the view from outside.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is incorrect because transparent objects like clear glass let all light pass through, which is not the purpose of bathroom windows. Option C is incorrect because opaque objects block all light, which would make the bathroom very dark. Option D is incorrect because frosted glass does not make the room brighter, it just allows some light to come in while providing privacy.

questions.question_text: Why doesn't a shadow have any color?

options.text: Because shadows are made of air
Because shadows are areas where light is blocked
Because objects lose their color in shadows

questions.explanation_correct: Shadows don't have any color because they are areas where light is blocked. When light is blocked by an object, the space behind the object becomes a shadow that appears dark or black, without any color.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shadows don't have color because they are not made of air. Shadows are simply the absence of light in an area behind an opaque object that is blocking the light. The object itself still has its own color, but the shadow appears black or dark because no light is reaching that space.

questions.question_text: Light travels very:

options.text: At the same speed as sound

questions.explanation_correct: Light travels very fast, at a speed of about 300,000 kilometers per second. This is much faster than the speed of sound, which is around 340 meters per second.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Light does not travel slowly, in circles, or at the same speed as sound. Light is a form of energy that can travel very quickly through space. The correct answer is that light travels very fast, much faster than other things like sound or even the fastest cars.

questions.question_text: A rough wall does not show clear reflections like a mirror because:

options.text: It doesn't reflect light at all
It reflects light in many different directions
It is not made of glass

questions.explanation_correct: A rough wall does not show clear reflections like a mirror because it reflects light in many different directions. The bumpy surface of the wall causes the light to scatter and bounce off in various angles, instead of reflecting in one clear direction like a smooth mirror surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is that a rough wall does not show clear reflections because it reflects light in many different directions. It is not because the wall doesn't reflect light at all, or because it absorbs all light, or because it is not made of glass. The bumpy surface of the wall causes the light to scatter and bounce off in various angles, instead of reflecting in one clear direction like a smooth mirror surface.

questions.question_text: The Sun is a natural source of light.
questions.explanation_correct: The Sun is a natural source of light because it is a star that gives off its own light. The Sun is a huge ball of hot gases that produces its own light energy, which is how we are able to see it in the sky.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Sun is not an artificial source of light. Artificial sources of light are things that are made by humans, like light bulbs, candles, and flashlights. The Sun is a natural source of light because it is a star that produces its own light energy, unlike artificial sources that need to be turned on or lit.

questions.question_text: Light travels in curved lines.
questions.explanation_correct: Light travels in straight lines, not curved lines. This is because light is a form of energy that moves through space very quickly in a straight path.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Light does not travel in curved lines. Light is a type of energy that moves in a straight line, not a curved line. If light traveled in curved lines, we would not be able to see things clearly or cast sharp shadows.

questions.question_text: Transparent objects allow all light to pass through.
questions.explanation_correct: Transparent objects like glass and water allow all light to pass through them, so the answer 'true' is correct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some objects like frosted glass or oiled paper are translucent, which means they let some light pass through. Opaque objects like wood and metal block all light. Only transparent objects allow all light to pass through.

questions.question_text: Opaque objects do not form shadows.
questions.explanation_correct: Opaque objects do form shadows because they block the light from reaching the area behind them. The light cannot pass through opaque objects, so it creates a shadow on the opposite side of the light source.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Opaque objects do form shadows. When light shines on an opaque object, the light cannot pass through it. This blocks the light and creates a dark area behind the object, called a shadow. The shadow has the same shape as the opaque object.

questions.question_text: A shadow has the same shape as the object that forms it.
questions.explanation_correct: A shadow has the same shape as the object that blocks the light because the shadow is created by the shape of the object. The light cannot pass through the opaque object, so the shadow has the same outline as the object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students might think that a shadow can have a different shape than the object. However, this is not true. The shadow is formed by the shape of the object blocking the light. The shadow will always have the same outline or shape as the object that is blocking the light.

questions.question_text: A shadow forms on the same side as the light source.
questions.explanation_correct: A shadow forms on the opposite side of the light source. This is because light travels in straight lines, so when an opaque object blocks the light, it casts a shadow on the other side of the object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shadow forms on the opposite side of the light source, not on the same side. This is because light travels in straight lines, and the shadow appears where the light is blocked by the object. The shadow has the same shape as the object and is cast on the other side from the light source.

questions.question_text: Mirrors reflect light.
questions.explanation_correct: Mirrors are a type of smooth, shiny surface that can reflect light very well. When light hits a mirror, it bounces off the surface and the light is reflected, allowing us to see our reflection in the mirror.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some people may think that mirrors do not reflect light, but this is not correct. Mirrors are a special type of surface that can reflect light very well. When light hits a mirror, the light bounces off the surface and is reflected, which is why we can see our reflection in the mirror.

questions.question_text: You can see clearly through translucent objects.
questions.explanation_correct: Translucent objects do not let all light pass through. They only let some light pass through, which means you cannot see clearly through them. So the answer 'false' is correct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You might think you can see clearly through translucent objects like frosted glass or oiled paper because they let some light pass through. However, translucent objects do not let all the light pass through, so the image you see will be blurry or distorted. That's why the correct answer is 'false'.

questions.question_text: Moving the light source closer to an object makes the shadow larger.
questions.explanation_correct: When the light source is moved closer to an object, the shadow becomes larger because the light rays spread out more and cover a bigger area on the surface behind the object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Moving the light source closer to an object does not make the shadow smaller. In fact, the shadow becomes larger. This is because the light rays spread out more and cover a bigger area on the surface behind the object when the light source is closer.

questions.question_text: Light travels faster than sound.
questions.explanation_correct: Light travels much faster than sound. Light travels at a speed of about 300,000 kilometers per second, while sound travels at a speed of only about 340 meters per second. This means that light is almost a million times faster than sound.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Some students might think that sound travels faster than light because sound seems to reach our ears faster than light reaches our eyes. However, this is not true. Light is a form of energy that travels extremely fast, while sound is a vibration that travels much slower through the air or other materials.

questions.question_text: Light travels in _____ lines.
questions.explanation_correct: Light travels in straight lines because it moves in a direct path without bending or curving. This is why light casts shadows in a straight line behind opaque objects that block its path.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Light does not travel in curved or zigzag lines. The accepted answer 'straight' is correct because light always moves in a straight line, without changing direction, as it travels from the light source to our eyes. Light cannot bend or curve on its own.

questions.question_text: Objects that allow all light to pass through are called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Objects that allow all light to pass through are called transparent. This is because transparent objects do not block or absorb the light, so all of it can pass through easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer that is correct is 'transparent'. Transparent objects are ones that allow all light to pass through them, like glass and water. This is different from opaque objects, which block all light, and translucent objects, which let some light through. The correct answer is 'transparent' because it describes the objects that let all light pass through.

questions.question_text: Objects that do not allow any light to pass through are called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Objects that do not allow any light to pass through are called opaque. This is because opaque objects, like wood or metal, block all the light and do not let it pass through at all.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'opaque'. Opaque objects are objects that do not allow any light to pass through them. This means that the light cannot go through the object, and it is blocked completely. Other types of objects like transparent and translucent allow some or all light to pass through, but opaque objects do not let any light pass through.

questions.question_text: Objects that allow some light to pass through are called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Translucent objects are the ones that allow some light to pass through them, like frosted glass or oiled paper. This is the correct answer because it matches the description in the topic context.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'translucent'. Objects that block all light are called opaque, not translucent. Opaque objects do not let any light pass through, like wood or metal. Translucent objects let some light pass through, which is the correct answer here.

questions.question_text: A _____ forms when an opaque object blocks light.
questions.explanation_correct: A shadow forms when an opaque object blocks light because opaque objects do not let any light pass through them. This means the light from the light source is blocked, creating a dark area on the other side of the object - this dark area is called a shadow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'shadow'. A shadow is the dark area that forms when an opaque object blocks light from a light source. Opaque objects, like wood or metal, do not let any light pass through them. This blocks the light and creates a shadow on the other side of the object.

questions.question_text: When light bounces off a surface, it is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: When light bounces off a surface, the process is called reflection. This happens because the light ray hits the surface and then changes direction, just like a ball bounces when it hits a wall.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The process of light bouncing off a surface is called reflection. The correct answer to the question is 'reflection'. Other options like 'refraction' or 'absorption' do not describe what happens when light hits a surface and changes direction.

questions.question_text: The Sun, stars, and fire are _____ sources of light.
questions.explanation_correct: The Sun, stars, and fire are natural sources of light because they are found in nature and produce light without needing electricity or other human-made power sources.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Sun, stars, and fire are not artificial sources of light. Artificial sources of light are things made by humans, like light bulbs, lamps, and torches. Natural sources of light are things that produce light naturally, without needing human-made power. The Sun, stars, and fire are all examples of natural light sources.

questions.question_text: Bulbs, torches, and candles are _____ sources of light.
questions.explanation_correct: Bulbs, torches, and candles are artificial sources of light because they are made by humans to produce light, unlike natural sources like the Sun, stars, and fire which occur naturally.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bulbs, torches, and candles are not natural sources of light. They are 'artificial' sources, which means they are made by humans to produce light, unlike the Sun, stars, and fire which occur naturally. The correct answer is 'artificial'.

questions.question_text: A shadow always forms on the _____ side of the light source.
questions.explanation_correct: A shadow always forms on the opposite side of the light source because light travels in straight lines. When an opaque object blocks the light, it creates a shadow on the side of the object that is facing away from the light source.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The shadow does not form on the same side as the light source. This is because the light cannot pass through the opaque object, so the shadow appears on the opposite side. The correct answer is 'opposite'.

questions.question_text: Smooth, shiny surfaces like _____ reflect light very well.
questions.explanation_correct: Mirrors are very smooth and shiny surfaces that reflect light very well. When light hits a mirror, it bounces off the mirror's surface and reflects back, allowing us to see a clear image in the mirror.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'mirrors'. Smooth, shiny surfaces like mirrors have a special property that allows them to reflect light very well. Other objects like wood or metal are not as good at reflecting light, so they would not be the correct answer. Mirrors are the best choice because they have a very smooth and shiny surface that can reflect light effectively.

questions.question_text: Your shadow is shortest when the sun is directly _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Your shadow is shortest when the sun is directly overhead because the sun's light is shining straight down on you, creating a small, compact shadow. When the sun is at an angle, your shadow becomes longer and stretched out.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer is 'overhead'. Your shadow is shortest when the sun is directly overhead, meaning it is directly above you in the sky. This is because the sun's light is shining straight down on you, creating a small, compact shadow. If the sun is not directly overhead, your shadow will be longer and stretched out.

questions.question_text: Clear water and air are examples of _____ materials.
questions.explanation_correct: Clear water and air are transparent materials because they allow all light to pass through them. Transparent objects let light travel through them without blocking or changing the light.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer is 'transparent'. Glass and water are transparent because they do not block light. Opaque materials like wood and metal block all light, while translucent materials like frosted glass let some light through but not all of it.

questions.question_text: Arrange to form a shadow:
ordering_items: Light is blocked by opaque object
Opaque object is placed in front of screen
correct_answer: Opaque object is placed in front of screen
Light is blocked by opaque object
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Light source is turned on, Opaque object is placed in front of the screen, Light is blocked by the opaque object, and then the shadow appears on the screen. This is because the light needs to be present first, then an opaque object needs to block the light in order to create a shadow on the screen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Shadow appears on the screen, Light source is turned on, Light is blocked by opaque object, Opaque object is placed in front of screen. questions.question_text: Arrange from most light passing through to least light passing through:
